intro: Chamaesyce rubida, commonly known as redstem sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features hairy, lobed leaves that are often reddish or purplish in color, especially when young. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, branched inflorescences, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Chamaesyce rubida is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields.
